title: Firefox cannot connec to a certain website and that's mine
content:
Hello there,

I installed Firefox with high expectation, and mostly it satisfied me but this issue: it cannot connect to the server at my portfolio website. Firefox apps on iPad, iPhone, and Android can. It only happens on the desktop Firefox on PC.

For your information, Firefox is allowed through Windows Defender Firewall.

Weirdly enough, it works immediately once I create a new Firefox profile. But the issue just comes back when I reboot my PC and start Firefox with the profile which worked one minute before. I have no idea what kind of glitch it is, but I thought anyone might know about it. Any suggestion?

Best regrads, HM

title: Firefox Web Scrollbar
content:
Hola,

Somos desarrolladores de aplicaciones web y tras la última actualización de Firefox (actualmente 107.0) algunos usuarios se han quejado de que la barra de scroll les tapa parte del contenido y este no permite hacer algunas acciones. La barra no es visible por defecto y cuando aparece tapa el contenido en lugar de ajustarse a este como hacía antes.

Los usuarios son tanto de Windows como de Linux.

Tras hacer varios intentos con CSS (ya que arreglar cada apartado a nivel individual dándole más padding para cubrir la parte del scroll es inviable) nos ponemos en contacto con ustedes a ver si pueden darnos la solución a este probelma.

Les envio 1 imágen mostrando el problema.

Gracias de antemano.
creator: nmartin4

title: Inter device security

The iMac is a shared device and I want to prevent other devices seeing what web pages are being viewed on any of my devices. That make all devices private to the user, I can't find how to do that.
creator: purdysi57

title: Error 3000 in twitch
content:
Hello guys,

I just got a new M2 SSD and I just decided to reinstall Windows and everything on it. However, when I installed Firefox I started getting this exact error message on all twitch streams: "Your browser encountered an error while decoding the video. (Error #3000):. Keep in mind I have tried most if not every "fix" I've found. I've disabled the hardware acceleration, cleared cookies and cache, I've disabled the extensions, I've tried Incognito mode, I do not have a third-party anti-virus and I do not have a VPN. This works on all other browsers and it used to work on Firefox before I wiped my PC, so that I can install Windows again. I really do not want to use a different browser, I love everything about Firefox right now.

Any suggestions will do, thank you very much.
creator: ae.dimitar

title: Can't get Firefox Multi-Account Containers to sync - is there a way to transfer the container config one time?
content:
I'm moving to a new computer and installed Firefox.

I've done a sync and everything moved over except for my container settings/configuration.

On the new Windows PC, the Firefox settings look like this: If I go to the Sync settings for Firefox: about:preferences?entrypoint=fxa_app_menu#sync It says: You are currently syncing these items. But Containers is not on the list.

If I go to the General settings for Firefox: about:preferences#general It says: Enable Container Tabs is checked but greyed out.

If I go to the Firefox Multi-Account Containers settings, Enable synchronisation is checked.

If I can't get sync to work, is there a file I can copy from the old computer and move to the new one that has all the Container conifguraiton details?

Thanks
creator: JoeFFox

title: Am I supposed to get multiple "new sign-in on your account" emails for the same/a single sing in?
content: Everything I sign in to my account I I will get 4 different emails alerting me of the sign in and it always stresses me out thinking someone else mightve signed into my account at the same time time I did. I have 2 different email addresses associated with my account, the main on and the recovery one. So it makes sense why Im getting the "new sign-in" email twice but I dont understand why I'm getting it twice to both emails. All sign ins come from the same IP address but not mine (I use a VPN) but 2 will have a slighty different time (2-3 minutes) than the other 2. I also have 2 factor authentication set up with Microsoft authenticatior so is the double authentication what might be causing the double emails? I'm sorry if the way I worded this makes no sense but I'm super serious about security and Im tired of changing my password out of fear everytime I do new sign-in.
creator: HybridBunny

title: How to disable restore session when reboot computer
content:

I also find someone say to set `browser.sessionstore.resume_from_crash` in `about:config`, but it doesn't work, and I don't think it is the proper way to solve this problem because reboot is not crash.
